en: Wail, cypress,   for the cedar has fallen;

ngiemboon: Mé ne ńjúʼu páʼ papféle menɔ̀ɔn gaʼte,
en: Listen to the wail   of the shepherds,  # 11:3 Zch 10:2–3

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, à tsẅǐ né mèŋ ngie: «Gwɔ́ mpfèle menjʉ̀njÿò mie mé gẅiin légwa.
en: The Lord my God says this: “Shepherd the flock intended for slaughter.

ngiemboon: Pajú menjʉ̀njÿò ŋwɛ́, pɔ́ jú ńzẅé, ḿbiŋ ńkwaŋ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ té ne ńgÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́. Pasẅiŋe gɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: “Ayɔɔn mbà pege cʉ̌ʼ megàŋa mmó, pege síe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a!” Papféle wɔ́b zɔɔn ḿbú te gẅiin lagá tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe na pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Those who buy them slaughter them but are not punished.   Those who sell them say, ‘Blessed be the Lord because I have become rich!’ Even their own shepherds have no compassion for them.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N te gÿo gíŋ gẅiin tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe nzèm patsẅé ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́. N ge sẅéen wɛ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ɔ, é náa mbwó ngàŋ nkwɔʼɔ́ nkáʼ we, mbɔɔ mbwó fùɔ. Mefùɔ ge gÿo pú zẅéte pʉ̀a ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ; m biŋ le fó mesoŋ pɔ́b ńkẅile lagá nyìŋ wɔ́.»
en: Indeed, I will no longer have compassion on the inhabitants of the land” #— #this is the Lord’s declaration. “Instead, I will turn everyone over to his neighbor and his king. They will devastate the land, and I will not rescue it from their hand.”

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, n cʉ́ʼʉ mpfèle menɔ̀ɔn pie patáŋ sɔ̌ɔn petepòŋ, la jú, é faʼa lézẅé. N da leen ḿbí mekèm tÿǒ lɔg ḿpféle menɔ̀ɔn mémbʉ́a, ńtóŋo ndùŋmvfò lê «leshǔ», ńtóŋo mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a lê «tèmte», ńdeen ńké ńzye lepfelé menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: So I shepherded the flock intended for slaughter, the oppressed of the flock.   I took two staffs, calling one Favor  # 11:7 Ps 90:17; Zch 11:10 and the other Union, and I shepherded the flock.

ngiemboon: N da lɔgɔ tàʼ saŋ, ńtág papféle menɔ̀ɔn pɔ́b méntá; menɔ̀ɔn la gÿo tà mèŋ cʉʼʉ́ ńkuʼu léshÿɔg wɔ́. Pɔ́b yɔ́b cʉ́ʼ ńdíe wɔ́ɔn, m bÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b pÿɔ̌g.
en: In one month I got rid of three shepherds. I became impatient with them, and they also detested me.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, n gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «N te gíŋ pféle gẅí wɔ́. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pi ge kwéte, pi kwéte! Ńgwɔ́ gie pi ge zẅíŋ, mé zẅé gẅí, pi zẅíŋ mé zẅé gẅí! Etsɔ́ na pi lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńnyé wó, ńgwɔ́ gie é ge sele pfɛ́ mennɛ́ mɔ́b, pɔ́ pfɛ́!»
en: Then I said, “I will no longer shepherd you. Let what is dying die, and let what is perishing perish; let the rest devour each other’s flesh.”

ngiemboon: N da gɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńkaa tÿǒ yɔ́ɔn gie lezíŋ ée lê «leshǔ» la, ḿbwɔ́ʼ. Ńgÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ḿbyága kʉ̀a gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo pâ láʼa ntsèm gwa.
en: Next I took my staff called Favor and cut it in two, annulling the covenant I had made with all the peoples.

ngiemboon: Akʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ la mag lyɛ̌ʼ ayɛ̌. Patáŋsɔ̌ɔn petepòŋ pie é la ne ńdíe wɔ́ɔn, é zsé ngie ammó gie n gÿo, á fóo né Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: It was annulled on that day, and so the oppressed of the flock   who were watching me knew that it was the word of the Lord.

ngiemboon: N da gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi lɔɔn ńgyá ngie áa mbòŋ, pi péen wɔ́ɔn, ńké té púʼu wɔ́, pi tsẅé jʉʼ!» Pɔ́ leen ńké ńdɔg nkáb pàg móm tá ḿbéen wɔ́ɔn.
en: Then I said to them, “If it seems right to you, give me my wages; but if not, keep them.” So they weighed my wages, thirty pieces of silver.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Yɛ̂ áa mmó gie pɔ́ gyǎ ngie á kuʼu na gù! Lɔg ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó ndɔ̀ɔn tʉ̌.» N deen ńké ḿbí nkáb ŋwɛ́ pàg móm ntá, ńgʉa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńnáa mbwó ndɔ̀ɔn tʉ̌.
en: “Throw it to the potter,”   the Lord said to me #— #this magnificent price I was valued by them. So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw it into the house of the Lord, to the potter.  # 11:13 One Hb ms, Syr read treasury,# 11:13 Mt 26:15; 27:3–10

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo púʼu, ńkaa tÿǒ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gie lezíŋ ée lê «tèmte», ḿbwɔ́ʼ. Ńgÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńcʉŋte mmó gie á kɔ́ɔn ńtémte pà Yúndà pâ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ tá pɔ́ gwɔ́ mefɛ̌.
en: Then I cut in two my second staff, Union, annulling the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńké ńgíŋe ńtsẅi né mèŋ ngie: «Cʉ́ʼ ńgÿo fʉ̀ʼɔɔn pɔ́ páʼ mbyɛ̀bmvfó gẅie aa gʉ̀gʉ̀.
en: The Lord also said to me, “Take the equipment of a foolish shepherd.

ngiemboon: Á nue n ge gÿo túmo tàʼ mpfèle menɔ̀ɔn wesẅé, é náa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ. À te gÿo sáŋa nò, é náa na menɔ̀ɔn pie é ka kweté wɔ́. É ké le gʉa faʼ menɔ̀ɔn pie é ka pyeté wɔ́. À te gÿo zoŋ pie é lÿǒon mefʉ̌ŋ wɔ́; é ké le náa mmó mpfɛ̌ mbwó pie é nyé ńgwɔ́ ntentʉ́ wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, mbà à ge gÿo zẅé pie é fáŋte, é pfɛ́, tà pfɛ́ mentyɛʼɛ́ kwò mɔ́b.»
en: I am about to raise up a shepherd in the land who will not care for those who are perishing, and he will not seek the lost   or heal the broken. He will not sustain the healthy,  # 11:16 Or exhausted but he will devour the flesh of the fat sheep  # 11:16 Ezk 34:3–4 and tear off their hooves.

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó mpfèle menɔ̀ɔn wetepòŋ
